an9.44:1.1: “Reverend, they speak of a person called ‘freed by wisdom’.
an9.44:1.2: What is the one freed by wisdom that the Buddha spoke of?”
an9.44:2.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures … enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.44:2.2: And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.44:2.3: To this extent the Buddha spoke of the one freed by wisdom in a qualified sense. …
an9.44:3.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.44:3.2: And they understand that with wisdom.
an9.44:3.3: To this extent the Buddha spoke of the one freed by wisdom in a definitive sense.”
